name: Barnfield House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's taken me some time to write this review because I can't think of anything original to say; the other reviews say it all. Michael and Helen have a talent for what they do; the place is immaculate; everything is provided; nothing is too much trouble (thanks for the use of the tumble dryer, Helen, it's the couple who insisted on walking round Damflask during the storm) and, above all, they have time for you. The house is ideally located; the views stunning and there's the Bradfield Brewery brewery tap, the Nag's Head just down the road! What more could you want?
reviews.title: Faultless
Fabulous place
reviews.text: Just awarded a gold star and well deserved. We stayed one night with our 17 year old daughter. Two beautiful rooms, very clean and comfy- bathrooms spotless and towelling robes also provided. Yorkshire breakfast wonderful. Lovely welcome- hopefully have an excuse to return

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: This place is probably the best home from home you could ask for! And is certainly one of the best places I've EVER stayed in before. The family run guest house is very welcoming, wonderfully stress-free and extremely well organised. You will receive a first class breakfast, wonderful themed Robin of Loxley room with nice details and very comfortable bed. The dining area and lobby are both very spacious plus Helen and her husband exceptionally friendly, warm and helpful (especially when spotting my signs of a friends wedding party hangover!) I seriously could've stayed all week - and hopefully next time I will. Thank you so much for such a comfortable stay, I will highly recommend that others visit such a beautiful area of GB. Steve S

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by far the best B&B accommodation we've stayed in - as advertised it is set in open countryside on the edge of the National Peak Park and has an enjoyable large garden and a large lounge for relaxing.
reviews.title: Real 5* Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner, Helen offered us a very warm welcome and has lots of experience in the Hotel industry and this shows in the quality and cleanliness of Barnfield House. Lots of little touches - dressing gowns, slippers, chocolates etc which are often only found in top 5* hotels (and not always found in those!!!)
reviews.title: Excellent all round indeed!

description: A warm welcome and first class hospitality await you at our luxury guest accommodation. Uniquely located in the beautiful surroundings of Loxley Valley on the edge of the National Peak park, yet only minutes from the vibrant city of Sheffield - Barnfield House really does offer the "best of both worlds". Our award-winning breakfast menu is bursting with high quality local produce to give our guests the best possible start to the day!
